edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgnmntFINAL

Class PowerUp

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgnmntFINAL.PowerUp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BallOfEnergy, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AmmoIncrease, Invincibility, Radar

    public abstract class PowerUp
extends java.lang.Object
implements BallOfEnergy, java.io.Serializable
    Power up class is set up to give the player the advantage of the game. Power ups allow the player to recieve one more bullet, become invincible, or to reveal the document for the player. Of course, the player would need to find these power ups in the grid in order to recieve these advantages. These powerups are set randomly across the grid for the player to find.
    Author:
    Mario Garcia, Anuja Joshi, Michelle Duoung, Matthew Musquiz, Kristin Adachi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean active
      Active is the boolean to determine whether the powerup should still be within the game or not.

      the UID serial used to check the authenticity of the save that the player attempts to load in to.

      Provides the name and symbol that represent the power up that will be displayed on the game world.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PowerUp

        public PowerUp(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String symbol,
               javax.swing.JLabel img)
        The constructor for the power up. This is used to create the power up that is specified.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the power up that will be activated.
        symbol - - the symbol used to represent the power up.

    • Method Detail

      • revealed

        public void revealed()
        reveals the symbol of the powerup to the player, if the player looks in to the direction of the power up.

      • hidden

        public void hidden()
        hides the power up after the player has seen it.

      • hide

        public java.lang.String hide()
        Determines whether the symbol of the power up will be revealed on the grid, or remain hidden in the fog. This is also determined if the power up hasn't been activated. If so, the power up will no longer be visible in the grid, nor will it be used again.
        Returns:
        symbol - the symbol to represent the current state of visibility of the power up.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        returns the name of the powerup.
        Returns:
        name - the string name of the powr up.

      • activate

        public boolean activate(Spy spy,
                        Room[] rooms)
        Activates the power up, which is based on which one was activated. Activate will be overridden depending on which one the player walks upon. This will by default deactivate the power up after, which will overall remove the power up from the game.
        Parameters:
        spy - - the player that the power up will act on.
        rooms - - the rooms that the power up will act on. This is only used by its subclass Radar.
        Returns:
        active - the current state of the power up, if false this power up will be removed from the game for the duration.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Returns the current state of the power up.
        Returns:
        active - the state of the power up. This is used to determine whether the player has walked over the power up.

      • getLocation

        public void getLocation(int row,
                        int col)
        sets the location of the power up, by reassigning the coordinates by row and coloumn.
        Specified by:
        getLocation in interface BallOfEnergy
        Parameters:
        row - - the row in which to set the location of the powerup.
        col - - the coloumn in which to set the location of the powerup.

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        Returns the current row coordinate that the power up is located in.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
